contents:
高频单词 according adj: 相应的; 相符的; 一致的; v: 给予; 符合; 一致; 正式协议 (accord的现在分词) 例句 It's wrong to judge peoper only according to their family background.仅仅根据一个人的家庭背景来评判他人是错误的 Over-the-counter hearing aids, such as Apple's offering, are also not a treatment for severe hearing loss according to FDA.根据美国食品药品监督管理局的说法,非处方助听器(例如苹果的产品)，也不是治疗严重听力损失的方法 固定搭配 It's wrong to do sth做某事是错误的 according to根据 …… such as例如 a treatment for治疗 …… 的方法/手段 单词 judge评判 their family background他们的家庭背景 after prep: 在 …… 之后; 紧接着; 跟随; 在 …… 身后; 与 …… 对照; 对比;鉴于;由于;尽管;寻找;追捕;关于;模仿;依照 conj: 在 …… 之后; adv: 后来 以后 adj: 之后的,后来的 例句 We finally reached an agreement after three months of hard bargaining.经过三个月的激烈谈判,我们终于达成了一项协议。 After driving for twelve hours, I was so tired that I could hardly keep my eyes open.开了十二个小时的车后,我累的几乎睁不开眼睛 固定搭配 reach an agreement达成协议 after three months of ...在 …… 之后 hard bargaining激烈/艰苦的谈判 animal n: 动物 兽类 衣冠禽兽 畜牲 某一类人或物
adj: 动物的 肉体的 肉欲的 非理性的 To stay warm in frosty weather, cold-blooded animals must expose themselves to a source of warmth such as direct sunlight.
为了在严寒的天气里保暖,变温动物必须让自己接触阳光直射等热源。
解析
动词不定式短语作目的状语 + 主语 + 情态动词 + 动词 + 宾语 + 其他 To stay warm in frosty weather 动词不定式短语作目的状语， 表示 “为了在寒冷天气里保持温暖” 主句部分用情态动词（这里是 must）+ 动词原形 固定搭配
To stay warm（保持温暖，为了保持温暖） in frosty weather（在寒冷的天气里） expose themselves to（使自己暴露于……/接触……） a source of warmth（热源） such as（例如，比如） As we know, all animals need air, and so do plants.
正如我们所知，所有动物都需要空气，植物也是如此。
解析
As 在这里相当于一个关系代词，指代后面整个主句 “all animals need air, and so do plants” 它和主句之间用逗号隔开，是非限制性定语从句的特征。 固定搭配
as we know（正如我们所知） so do plants（植物也是如此） He is the only animal that can be taught to push and pull.
他是唯一可以被训练来推和拉的动物。
解析
that → 关系代词，指代先行词 “the only animal” can be taught → 情态动词被动语态 “can”（情态动词）+ “be taught”（被教导） to push and pull → 不定式短语，作 teach 的宾语补足语（说明教什么） 固定搭配
the only … that … (唯一……的……) can be taught (能被教会/被教导) 情态动词 + 被动语态 can be done, should be done, must be done 等 as prep: 作为; 像 如同 以……身份; 当作 当……时 conj: 当…时候 随着 虽然 尽管 因为 由于 以至于 adv: 同样 一样 例如 诸如 As they don’t have a child of their own, they are going to adopt a little girl.
因为他们没有自己的孩子, 他们将收养一个小女孩
解析
由 As 引导的原因状语从句, 相当于 because / since 意为 “因为, 由于” 固定搭配
a child of their own (他们自己的孩子) of one’s own (属于某人自己的) be going to do sth (打算、计划做某事) adopt a little girl (收养一个小女孩) as much (相同数量、同样多的)
as much … as … (和…一样多的…) He earns as much money as I do. (他赚的钱和我一样多。)
as much as + 数字 (高达…) As much as $10,000 was spent on the project. (高达一万美元被花在这个项目上。)
away adv: 不在; 离开; 朝另一个方向; 在别处; 距离…有多远; 距离…有多久; (放)在安全的地方; 逐渐消失; 一直; 继续不断地; 移走 They live two kilometers away from the railway station.
他们住在离火车站两公里的地方。
固定搭配
live … away from (离……多远的地方居住) away from … (远离……；距……有……) become v: 成为; 变得; 变成; 适合; 使显得漂亮 现在分词: becoming
过去分词: become
过去式: became
第三人称单数: becomes Children who are over protected by their parents may become spoiled. 那些被父母过度保护的孩子可能会被宠坏。
解析
结构 主语 + 限定性定语从句 + 情态动词 + 系动词 + 表语 限定性定语从句。 Children (先行词); who 关系代词,引导定语从句; may 情态动词; are over protected (被动语态); by their parents (动作的施动者) 固定搭配
be over protected by … (被……过度保护) may become … (可能会变得……) become spoiled (变得被宠坏) cause n: 原因; 事业; 理由
v: 导致; 引起; 现在分词: causing
过去分词: caused
过去式: caused
第三人称单数: causes As climate change causes more severe weather, the need for backup power solutions is increasing.
由于气候变化导致极端天气加剧，人们对备用电源解决方案的需求正在增加。
解析
结构 As + 原因状语从句 + 主句 As climate change causes more severe weather. As连词，引导原因状语从句，意为“随着/由于”; climate change 主语; causes → 谓语动词（现在时） 固定搭配
climate change causes … (气候变化导致……) more severe weather (更严重的天气 severe weather 是固定搭配) the need for … (对……的需求) backup power solutions (备用电源解决方案) is increasing (正在增长) People in the world differ in their beliefs about the cause of sickness and health.
世界各地的人们对健康和疾病的原因有不同的看法。
解析
主语 + 动词 differ + in + 名词短语 固定搭配
differ in … (在……方面不同) beliefs about … (关于……的看法/信念) the cause of sickness and health (健康与疾病的成因) People in the world (世界上的人们) The forest fire caused by the volcano is too difficult to put out. 由火山引发的森林大火太难熄灭了。
固定搭配
caused by … (被 … 引起/导致) too … to … (太 … 以至于不能 …) put out (熄灭/扑灭 火等) cell n: 细胞; 小牢房; 电解槽; 电池; 电芯; (政治组织的)小组; 基层组织; 单人小室 Blaes, one of the team members, said that if you can find people who are at higher risk because their cells are aging faster, you can target lifestyle interventions: things like healthy food, exercise and sleep and so on.
团队成员之一 Blaes 表示，如果你能找到那些因为细胞老化更快而处于更高风险中的人， 就可以有针对性地进行生活方式干预：比如健康饮食、锻炼、睡眠等等。
解析
主句 + 同位语 + said that + 条件状语从句 + 主句 + 举例 固定搭配
one of the … (… 之一) said that … (说 …) if you can find …, you can … (条件句：如果 … 就 …) at higher risk (处于更高风险中) cells are aging faster (细胞老化更快) target lifestyle interventions (有针对性地进行生活方式干预) things like … (比如 …) and so on (等等) could v: 可以, 能; 可能, 也许; 可以,能; 本该, 应该; 真想; 好像, 仿佛 Even when Jone was in his sixties, he took part in swimming competitions and a lot of younger people couldn’t keep up with him.
即使在 Jone 六十多岁的时候, 他仍然参加游泳比赛,许多比他年轻的人还跟不上他。
解析
让步状语从句 + 主句 + 并列句 结构 固定搭配
Even when … (即使在……时候) be in one’s sixties (在某人六十多岁时) take part in … (参加……) a lot of … (很多……) keep up with … (跟上……的步伐，不落后) After driving for twelve hours, I was so tired that I could hardly keep my eyes open. 开了十二个小时的车之后, 我累得几乎睁不开眼睛了。
解析
时间状语（After + 动名词短语）+ 主句 + 结果状语从句（so … that …） 固定搭配
After driving for twelve hours (开了十二小时车之后) so … that … (如此……以至于……) could hardly … (几乎不能……) keep my eyes open (睁着眼睛 比喻“打不起精神”) even adv: 甚至, 即使; 更加,愈加; 其实,实际上
adj: 平坦的, 水平的; 平静的, 平和的; 平稳的; 匀称的; 偶数的; 平等的, 公平的 Even on the most carefully prepared trip, problems will sometimes arise.
即使是在准备最充分的旅行中, 有时也会出现问题。
固定搭配
Even on … → 即使在…… the most carefully prepared trip → 准备最充分的旅行 will sometimes arise → 有时会出现（arise：出现/发生）
title: 高频单词 —— 第一天

Heading 1 Heading 2 Heading 3 Heading 4 Heading 5 Heading 6 それはほんの一握りだよ。
It's just only a handful of them. 英語日記添削をお願いするフレーズ There's something I'd like to ask you. お願いしたいことがあります。 I write English diary in English. 英語で日記を書いています。 I want you to check my diary for today. 今日の日記を確認してほしいです。 「英語日記BOY community」とは 新井リオさんの著書「英語日記BOY」購入者限定コミュニティ 専用Slackで参加者同士でやり取り 新井リオさんから直接ご指導いただくことも 月額1,000円（税込） ※「英語日記BOY」購入者のみ参加可能です。-> 詳細はこちら Emphasis Emphasis, aka italics, with asterisks or underscores.
Strong emphasis, aka bold, with asterisks or underscores.
Combined emphasis with asterisks and underscores.
Strikethrough uses two tildes. Scratch this.
Link I’m an inline-style link
I’m an inline-style link with title
I’m a reference-style link
I’m a relative reference to a repository file
You can use numbers for reference-style link definitions
Or leave it empty and use the link text itself.
URLs and URLs in angle brackets will automatically get turned into links. http://www.example.com or http://www.example.com and sometimes example.com (but not on Github, for example).
Some text to show that the reference links can follow later.

List List item List item List item List item List item Unordered List List item List item List item List item List item Code and Syntax Highlighting Inline code has back-ticks around it.
var s = "JavaScript syntax highlighting"; alert(s); s = "Python syntax highlighting" print s No language indicated, so no syntax highlighting. But let's throw in a <b>tag</b>. Blockquote This is a blockquote example.
Inline HTML You can also use raw HTML in your Markdown, and it’ll mostly work pretty well.
Definition list Is something people use sometimes. Markdown in HTML Does *not* work **very** well. Use HTML tags. Tables Colons can be used to align columns.
Tables Are Cool col 3 is right-aligned $1600 col 2 is centered $12 zebra stripes are neat $1 There must be at least 3 dashes separating each header cell. The outer pipes (|) are optional, and you don’t need to make the raw Markdown line up prettily. You can also use inline Markdown.
Markdown Less Pretty Still renders nicely 1 2 3 Image Youtube video
title: How To Use Checklists To Improve Your UX

var s = "JavaScript syntax highlighting"; alert(s); s = "Python syntax highlighting" print s No language indicated, so no syntax highlighting. But let's throw in a <b>tag</b>. Blockquote This is a blockquote example.
Inline HTML You can also use raw HTML in your Markdown, and it’ll mostly work pretty well.
Definition list Is something people use sometimes. Markdown in HTML Does *not* work **very** well. Use HTML tags. Tables Colons can be used to align columns.
Tables Are Cool col 3 is right-aligned $1600 col 2 is centered $12 zebra stripes are neat $1 There must be at least 3 dashes separating each header cell. The outer pipes (|) are optional, and you don’t need to make the raw Markdown line up prettily. You can also use inline Markdown.
